subject: Re: [junit] Test fails when run alone but passes when run together with others!
msgSnippet: The point being to make sure that *YOU* write your tests so that they are independent of each other.  If you write tests that effect data that other tests rely
messageBody:
The point being to make sure that *YOU* write your tests so that they are
independent of each other. If you write tests that effect data that other
tests rely on, you will have issues. I don't know if that is your problem
here, I just thought I'd "stir you up by way of remembrance."

-jason

--- Marko Schulz <4mschulz@...-hamburg.de> wrote:
> On Fri, Jan 18, 2002 at 01:02:25PM +0100, Morten Grum wrote:
> >
> > I have a TestCase for which one of its tests fails when the TestCase is run
> > alone but passes when the test is run together with other TestCases (in my
> > AllTests).
> >
> > I was under the impression that JUnit tests ran very independently so that
> > something like this could never happen. What could I be doing wrong? Where
> > should I look? Any tips.
>
> JUnit creates a new instance for each test, but it doesn't run every
> test in it's own JVM.
>
> Problems might come up, if you are using some kind of singleton or
> global data. Other sources of of trouble include the use of mechanisms
> that do additional class loading, such as CORBA.
>
> --
> marko schulz
>

> findet, darf sie behalten oder sammeln, bis sie ein L�sungswort ergeben.

(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
